title._content: [Unidentified soldier in Union uniform with canteen and bayoneted musket] (LOC)

description._content: [Unidentified soldier in Union uniform with canteen and bayoneted musket] [between 1861 and 1865] 1 photograph : sixth-plate tintype ; 9.5 x 8.5 cm (case) Notes: Title devised by Library staff. Case: (front) Berg, no. 3-164; (back) Berg, no. 1-54. Photograph shows uniform with a Volunteer Maine Militia belt plate. Gift; Tom Liljenquist; 2010; (DLC/PP-2010:105). Purchased from: The Horse Soldier, Cashtown, Pa. Published in: O'Donnell, Mike. U.S. Army and militia canteens, 1775-1910. Alexandria, Virginia : O'Donnell Publications, 2008, p. 153. Subjects: United States.--Army--People--1860-1870. Soldiers--Union--1860-1870. Military uniforms--Union--1860-1870. Canteens (Beverage containers)--1860-1870. Bayonets--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military personnel--Union. Format: Portrait photographs--1860-1870. Tintypes--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Ambrotype/Tintype filing series (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650518 Liljenquist Family collection (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650519 More information about this collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.lilj Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.26868 Call Number: AMB/TIN no. 2017

note._content: Doesn't look like anyone I know
